memberdef.name: DTree

briefdescription.para: Create a density estimation tree with the given bounds and the given number of total points.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum values of the bounding box.
Minimum values of the bounding box.
Total number of points in the dataset.

briefdescription.para: Create a density estimation tree on the given data.

detaileddescription.para: Children will be created following the procedure outlined in the paper. The data will be modified; it will be reordered similar to the way BinarySpaceTree modifies datasets.

memberdef.argsstring: (const StatType &maxVals, const StatType &minVals, const size_t start, const size_t end, const double logNegError)
memberdef.name: DTree

briefdescription.para: Create a child node of a density estimation tree given the bounding box specified by maxVals and minVals, using the size given in start and end and the specified error.

detaileddescription.para: Children of this node will not be created recursively.

parameterdescription.para: Start of points represented by this node in the data matrix.
End of points represented by this node in the data matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const StatType &maxVals, const StatType &minVals, const size_t totalPoints, const size_t start, const size_t end)
memberdef.name: DTree

briefdescription.para: Create a child node of a density estimation tree given the bounding box specified by maxVals and minVals, using the size given in start and end, and calculating the error with the total number of points given.

detaileddescription.para: Children of this node will not be created recursively.

parameterdescription.para: Start of points represented by this node in the data matrix.
End of points represented by this node in the data matrix.

briefdescription.para: Clean up memory allocated by the tree.
Return the upper part of the alpha sum.
Return the current bucket's ID, if leaf, or -1 otherwise.
Return the specified child (0 will be left, 1 will be right).

detaileddescription.para: If the index is greater than 1, this will return the right child.

briefdescription.para: Compute the logarithm of the density estimate of a given query point.
Compute the variable importance of each dimension in the learned tree.

parameterdescription.para: Vector to store the calculated importances in.

briefdescription.para: Return the first index of a point not contained in this node.
Return the tag of the leaf containing the query.

detaileddescription.para: This is useful for generating class memberships.

Index the buckets for possible usage later; this results in every leaf in the tree having a specific tag (accessible with BucketTag()).

detaileddescription.para: This function calls itself recursively. The tag is incremented with operator++(), so any TagType overriding it will do.

briefdescription.para: Find the dimension to split on.

memberdef.name: SplitData

briefdescription.para: Split the data, returning the number of points left of the split.
A density estimation tree is similar to both a decision tree and a space partitioning tree (like a kd-tree).

detaileddescription.para: Each leaf represents a constant-density hyper-rectangle. The tree is constructed in such a way as to minimize the integrated square error between the probability distribution of the tree and the observed probability distribution of the data. Because the tree is similar to a decision tree, the density estimation tree can provide very fast density estimates for a given point.
For more information, see the following paper:
